divs: Sighting DetailsAt 1:30 A M this morning, July 23, 2009, I was looking our of my office window and saw in the north east about 25-30 degrees up, what at first I took to be a star, but then it began flashing S O S like signals, so I watched it for about 5 or 6 minutes, then decided it wasn't going to be doing anything spectacular, so I went back to bed. There were other stars also visible but they were just steady points of light which made me think that this 'flasher' was something out of the ordinary. It appeared to be about the size of a half dollar and was quite bright. I thought it must be about as distant as Lake Comanche (about 10-12 miles from my house). Just another ho-hum light in the sky, I guess, but now I wish I had watched for a longer time.
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Lockeford
There were no other sightings in Lockeford on or around July 23rd 2009
Summary: flashing star-like object in the north east.
